info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 6:13PM EDT until June 13 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR KENTON...NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN...CAMPBELL...SOUTHERN BOONE... NORTHEASTERN GRANT...NORTHERN PENDLETON AND CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES... At 613 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Alexandria, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Crescent Springs, Walton, Crestview Hills, Lakeside Park, Oakbrook, Claryville, Union, Amelia and Wilder. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 74 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 167 and 186. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
